author: Deborah Reddihough
method: Preheat the oven to 200C/180C Fan/Gas 6. Cut the carrots and parsnips in half lengthways and cut any particularly large pieces in half again. Bring a large saucepan of water to the boil and add the vegetables. Boil for 3 minutes, or until the vegetables are just beginning to soften (you want them to keep their shape while roasting). Drain well and divide between 2 roasting trays (if the tray is crowded the vegetables wonâ€™t crisp up as well). Add the oil and mix to coat the vegetables. Season with salt and pepper and top with the Parmesan.  Roast for 25 minutes or until the carrots and parsnips are golden-brown at the edges.
ingredients: 7-8 carrots, peeled and trimmed,  7-8 parsnips, peeled and trimmed,  3 tbsp olive oil ,  30g/1oz Parmesan, grated,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
